author: Ascend Agency
title: Embark on a spiritual journey with Rock Solid Mamas’ crystal creations
text:
Crystal and gemstones have been valued for centuries for their incredible healing properties. Interestingly, this practice is still significant as millions worldwide say they have experienced profound spiritual healing with crystals. With the growing demand for crystal healing, many websites and proponents have crowded the market, but only a few stand out based on the authenticity of their products. With Rock Solid Mamas, people say they have found solace and experience spiritual soaring. Rock Solid Mamas is a movement emanating an aura of tranquility and mystique for anyone who works with them.
Thanks to its unique and original products, Rock Solid Mamas has drawn in seekers of spiritual healing like moths to a flame. Stacie Murphy and Cindy Yoder, the dynamic co-founders of Rock Solid Mamas, don’t consider themselves to be ordinary artisans; they describe themselves as alchemists of the soul. They create unique crystal jewelry and hope to weave magic with their hands and hearts.
The journey of Rock Solid Mamas began with a mutual passion for art and a deep-seated belief in the power of crystals and gemstones to heal and uplift. It all started as a humble endeavor that eventually became a thriving business. Each of their pieces is meticulously crafted to harness the energy of the earth’s precious stones. From the depths of amethyst to the embrace of carnelian, the collection that Rock Solid Mamas carries mesmerizes with a range of colors and energies. Each piece is said to resonate with a unique frequency that harmonizes mind, body and spirit.
Among all other similar entities, Rock Solid Mamas stands out for its commitment to customization, which allows seekers of spiritual healing to infuse their essence into every creation. Whether it is a personalized necklace with the protective properties of obsidian or a pair of earrings sparkling with citrine, each piece becomes a channel for the wearer’s intentions and aspirations.
Murphy and Yoder are often immersed in creativity. They exemplify the unique blend of intuition and craftsmanship in their products and services. Ailing souls can also reach out for help with Rock Solid Mamas’ official website and connect with the founders through email.
Beyond just a place to find exquisite pieces of original crystal jewelry, Rock Solid Mamas could be seen as a sanctuary for the weary soul to find respite and renewal. Through workshops and events, Murphy and Yoder offer a space for exploration and growth, guiding participants on a spiritual journey of self-discovery and empowerment.
The mission with Rock Solid Mamas goes beyond mere business. The founders feel a sense of responsibility and a sacred duty to spread light and healing. As Murphy and Yoder continue to weave their magic with each piece of crystal and gemstone, they can help people experience spiritual healing. So, the next time your life’s burdens weigh heavy, remember there is a place where two mamas with hearts of gold are waiting to heal you.

author: Patsy Newitt
title: Bad news for FTC's noncompete ban
text: The Federal Trade Commission has been largely silent on its proposed ban on noncompete contracts for full-time employees and independent contractors introduced January 2023, according to an article by law firm BakerHostetler published in [JDSupra](https://www.jdsupra.com/legalnews/does-new-york-s-failed-noncompete-bill-4175097/). A similar proposal in New York that was recently vetoed by Gov. Kathy Hochul could forecast a similar fate for the FTC proposal, according to the report. The New York bill, which was similar to the FTC's proposal, would have prohibited employers from seeking, requiring, demanding or accepting noncompete agreements from virtually any New Yorker. New York's bill "could be viewed as a canary in the coal mine of sorts, a prognostication of the political appetite for a nationwide blanket noncompete ban like the one proposed by the FTC," the law firm wrote. Ms. Hochul vetoed the bill, saying she supported banning noncompete agreements for low and middle-income workers. She criticized the full ban's inflexible approach that did not include an income cap and lacked exception for the sale of a business. Conversely, the FTC's noncompete rule, as currently drafted, has an exception for the sale of a business where a person subject to a noncompete has an ownership interest of at least 25%. "The fate of New York's noncompete ambitions marks an inauspicious start to the FTC's 2024 plans to rein in noncompetes," the report said, adding that the proposal also faces a potential judicial review by a Supreme Court "that is increasingly hostile toward the so-called administrative state."

author: Jennifer A. Dlouhy
title: Trump Administration Sues to Void Union Deals Across Government
text: Donald Trump’s administration moved to invalidate contracts between a swath of US government agencies and the largest federal union representing their employees, marking a sweeping attack on collective bargaining rights as the president aims to lay off government workers.In a lawsuit by the Justice Department, the Defense Department and other US agencies, the administration said that collective bargaining agreements reached with local chapters of the American Federation of Government Employees before Trump took office are impeding his efforts to reform the government and pose a threat to national security.The legal move late Thursday came shortly after Trump ... title: Sommerliche Musiktage Hitzacker mit Piano-Schwerpunkt
text:

Klassik-Fans zieht es im Sommer ins Wendland. Im Elbestädtchen Hitzacker findet zum 80. Mal das neuntägige Kammerfestival mit jungen Künstlern, Stars und innovativen Ideen statt.

author: Times Of India
title: Khusrau: ‘need To Revive Legacy Of Khusrau Among Young Generation’ | Lucknow News - Times of India
text: Lucknow: ‘Jahan-e-Khusrau', an event to commemorate Sufi culture, was organised by Anjuman-e-Farsi, department of Persian, Karamat Husain Muslim Girls' PG College on Thursday.Chief guest Arshadul Qadri, associate professor of Persian, Jamia Millia Islamia University, New Delhi, emphasised on reviving Khusrau's legacy among the young generation.Principal, Prof Huma Khwaja reiterated that Khusrau's contribution is a testament to the rich cultural heritage.Prof Tasneem K Chishti, head of department, highlighted how Khusrau's legacy continues to promote literary and cultural values universally.Persian renditions based on Khusrau's poetry, and Sufi dance fascinated the audience to the core.College manager, Syed Naved Ahmad said the event also saw events such as essay writing, rangoli, art and craft, digital designing, bait-bazi, qirat, qawwali, ghazals, and self -composed poetry recitation etc.The Kabeer Manjari Cultural Club and department of history, in collaboration with Adab Arz Lucknow, organized a quiz competition.Chief guest, Iffat Ara Khan, founder, Adab Arz, talked about the rich multicultural history of Lucknow.

author: themountains
title: SIMS 4 constantly crashing (unplayable). January 10th 2025 - Answer HQ
text: Sims 4 wont start up. automatically brings up blank page with loading swirl, never loads up, unable to minimize or close page unless done with task manager. not really sure what im doing, hope someone can help!!! this is the first time this has happened to me. ive been able to play regularly, just got this Nitro gaming laptop last month.. i was playing earlier today. not sure what could have caused this issue :/.
